intro: Psychotria strictistipula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and elliptical leaves with a pointed tip. Its small, white flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, black berries as fruit. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
